abstractContent.text: for analyzing domain-specific as well as temporal information in a well-defined text type.
The analysis, i.e. output, of the NLPS is a data structure which serves as the input to an expert system.
The ultimate Real is to allow the user of the expert system to enter data into the system by means of NL text which follows the linguistic conventions of English.
The particular domain chosen to illustrate the underlying theory of such a system ts that of medical descriptive re×is which deal with patients' case histories of Liver diseases.
The texts are taken unedtted from the Jourmal of the Amerzcan Medical As~oc£ation.

abstractContent.text: The The output of the program includes a lexical feature assignment as given in, a phrase-structure representation as given in, and a knowledge representation as provided in.

The resulting knowledge representation of mv NLPS consists of a series of events which are extracted from the text and chronologically ordered by the NLPS based on the stored knowledge the system has about the domain and ~enera [ temporal re[at ions.
The final knowledge representation (see) which my NLPS ~enerates is the input to the expert system or its database specialist.
The final output o[ the expert system is a diagnosis of the patient.
If a doctor were given a patient's case history (see, he would read the text and try to extract the salient pieces of information which are necessary for his diagnosis.
In this particular text type, he would be interested in the sign, symptoms, and laboratory data, as well as the medical history of the patient.
